author: Patrick Grafton-Green
title: North London bookshop owner tweets Harry Potter line-by-line to Piers Morgan
text:
Monday 13 February 2017 22:15 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Piers Morgan became embroiled in a spat with JK Rowling after he was told to f*** on live television Dave Benett 
A north London bookshop owner is tweeting Piers Morgan every line from the first Harry Potter book following the Good Morning Britain presenter's spat with JK Rowling. 
Simon Key, co-owner of the Big Green Bookshop in Wood Green, has already sent 275 tweets to Morgan, and plans to send a total of 32,567. 
It comes after Morgan told Rowling "this is why I've never read a single word of Harry Potter" during a furious Twitter row. 
The first message Mr Key sent was the very first line of the book: "Mr. and Mrs. Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much." . @piersmorgan Mr. and Mrs. Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much. â€” Big Green Bookshop (@Biggreenbooks) February 11, 2017 
He told Sky News : "I'm doing it because Piers clearly spends all day on Twitter staring at his timeline. 
"He clearly needs a bit of a break from all the abuse, so as he mentioned that he hasn't read any JK Rowling, rather then having to tear himself away from Twitter to read it, I'd tweet him."
